DataElement.preferredDefinition: The biospecimen grouping that describes the kind of material that forms the sample.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.:The tangible substance that goes into the makeup of a physical object.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Property.preferredDefinition: The tangible substance that goes into the makeup of a physical object.

Concepts.definition: The tangible substance that goes into the makeup of a physical object.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

DataElementConcept.administrativeNotes: 2/20/24 AI released per SME/Amanda Bell approval.ls2/1/23 released for reuse in CDS CDE. jk;  11/28/22 Changed property from Type to Material. mr;  11/17/22 Approved by Wendy, used in a CRDC DSS Standard, updated WF/RS to Released/Qualified per CRDC DSS. jk; 9/15/22 Created for CRDC per RFC12. mr;

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The sample or material being subjected to analysis.

Concepts.definition: The sample or material being subjected to analysis.

A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The accumulation of fluid in the peritoneal cavity, which may be serous, hemorrhagic, or the result of tumor metastasis to the peritoneum.

Concepts.definition: The accumulation of fluid in the peritoneal cavity, which may be serous, hemorrhagic, or the result of tumor metastasis to the peritoneum.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The soft, sponge-like tissue in the center of bones that produces white blood cells, red blood cells, and platelets.

Concepts.definition: The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid.

Concepts.definition: The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The material discharged from the bowel during defecation.  It consists of undigested food, intestinal mucus, epithelial cells, and bacteria.

Concepts.definition: The material discharged from the bowel during defecation.  It consists of undigested food, intestinal mucus, epithelial cells, and bacteria.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Liquid and semi liquid substances produced by living organisms to fulfill specific functions or excreted as waste; does not include hormones or enzymes.

Concepts.definition: Material produced by living organisms; it can be a necessary constituent of, or product of an organismal process.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Material containing mucus, cellular debris, microorganisms and sometimes blood or pus.  It is ejected through the mouth from the lungs, bronchi, and trachea.

Concepts.definition: Material containing mucus, cellular debris, microorganisms and sometimes blood or pus.  It is ejected through the mouth from the lungs, bronchi, and trachea.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The fluid that is excreted by the kidneys.  It is stored in the bladder and discharged through the urethra.

Concepts.definition: The fluid that is excreted by the kidneys.  It is stored in the bladder and discharged through the urethra.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.

Concepts.definition: An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A sample consisting of biological material from the buccal cavity. A collection solution is introduced into the mouth, swished around, and then collected.

Concepts.definition: A sample consisting of biological material from the buccal cavity. A collection solution is introduced into the mouth, swished around, and then collected.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.
